roborally.model
Class Robot

java.lang.Object
  roborally.model.Element
      roborally.model.Robot
All Implemented Interfaces:
EnergyElement
public class Robot
extends Element
implements EnergyElement

This class represents a robot.

Author:
Ben Adriaenssens (ben.adriaenssens@student.kuleuven.be) - WtkCws, Toon Nolten (toon.nolten@student.kuleuven.be) - CwsElt.
Invariants:
  • The energy of this Robot is always greater than or equal to 0 and less than or equal to it's maximum energy.
        0 <= getAmountOfEnergy() <= getMaxEnergy().getAmountOfEnergy()
  • The maximum energy of this robot can never exceed 20000 Ws.
        getMaxEnergy().getAmountOfEnergy() <= 20000
  • The energy needed to turn a robot is 100 Ws.
        getEnergyToTurn() = new Energy(100, unitOfPower.Ws)
  • The energy needed to move a robot is at least 500 Ws.
        getEnergyToMove.compareTo(new Energy(500, unitOfPower.Ws)) >= 0
  • The orientation of the robot is never null.
        getOrientation != null

    Constructor Detail

    Robot

    public Robot(Energy initialEnergy,
             Orientation initialOrientation)
    Initializes this Robot with an energy and an orientation.

    Parameters:
    initialEnergy - This is the initial energy of the robot.
    initialOrientation - This is the initial orientation of the robot.
    Preconditions:
  • The initial energy must exist.
        initialEnergy != null
  • The initial energy must be a valid energy.
        initialEnergy.isValidEnergy(new Energy(20000, unitOfPower.Ws))
    • Postconditions:
  • The energy of this Robot will be set to initialEnergy.
        new.getAmountOfEnergy() = initialEnergy
  • The Orientation of this Robot will be set to initialOrientation.
        new.getOrientation() = initialOrientation.
  • The position of this Robot will be set to null.
        new.getPosition() = null
    • Method Detail

    recharge

    public void recharge(Energy chargeEnergy)
    Recharge this Robot.

    Parameters:
    chargeEnergy - The energy that will be used to recharge this Robot.
    Preconditions:
  • The energy that is used to recharge must exist.
        chargeEnergy != null
  • The energy that is used to recharge must contain atleast 0 Ws.
        chargeEnergy.isValidEnergy(chargeEnergy)
    • Effect:
    The energy of this robot will be recharged until the chargeEnergy is empty or this Robot has reached it's maximum energy.
        new Energy ((new.getAmountOfEnergy()), UnitOfPower.Ws)
          = new Energy (getAmountOfEnergy(), UnitOfPower.Ws)
              .recharge(chargeEnergy, getMaxEnergy())

    increaseMaxEnergy

    public void increaseMaxEnergy(Energy energy)
    Increase the maximum energy of this Robot.

    Parameters:
    energy - The energy that will be used to increase this Robot's maximum energy.
    Preconditions:
  • energy must exist.
        energy != null
  • energy must be a positive energy.
        energy.compareTo(new Energy(0, unitOfPower.Ws)) >= 0
    • Effect:
    The current maximum energy maxEnergy will be increased with energy until energy is empty or the maximum energy reaches the energy limit of 20000 Ws.
        new.getMaxEnergy() =
          maxEnergy.recharge(energy, new Energy(20000, unitOfPower.Ws)

    getEnergyRequiredToReach

    public Energy getEnergyRequiredToReach(Position destination)
    Return the least possible energy for this robot to reach the given position.

    Parameters:
    destination - The destination position.
    Returns:
    null if the destination can not contain this element.
        if (!destination.canContainElement(this))
          result == null
    Returns:
    null if no path exists to the destination or the end of the calculated path is not the destination.
        Node shortestPath = new Node(null, getOrientation, 0,
          getPosition(), destination).shortestPath()
        if (shortestPath == null ||
          !(shortestPath.getPosition().equals(destination)))
          result == null
    Returns:
    The least possible energy for this robot to reach the given position otherwise.
        result == shortestPath.getEnergy()

    getEnergyRequiredToReachWs

    public double getEnergyRequiredToReachWs(Position destination)
    Return the least possible amount of energy in Ws for this robot to reach a given position.

    Parameters:
    destination - The destination position.
    Returns:
    -1 if the destination can not contain this element.
        if (!destination.canContainElement(this))
          result == -1
    Returns:
    -1 if no path exists to the destination or the end of the calculated path is not the destination.
        Node shortestPath = new Node(null, getOrientation, 0, getPosition(), destination).shortestPath()
        if (shortestPath == null ||
          !(shortestPath.getPosition().equals(destination)))
          result == -1
    Returns:
    The least possible amount of energy in Ws for this robot to reach the given position otherwise.
        result == shortestPath.getEnergy().getAmountOfEnergy

    public double getFractionOfEnergy()
    Returns the ratio of the current energy and maximum energy of this Robot.

    Returns:
    The ratio of this Robot's current energy to it's current maximum energy.
        result == getAmountOfEnergy() / getMaxEnergy().getAmountOfEnergy()

    turnClockwise90

    public void turnClockwise90()
    Turn this Robot clockwise 90 degrees.

    Precondition:
    The energy this Robot currently has must be more then the energy it needs to turn.
        getAmountOfEnergy() >= getEnergyToTurn().getAmountOfEnergy()
    Postcondition:
    The energy of this Robot will decrease due to the turning.
        new.getAmountOfEnergy() = getAmountOfEnergy() - getEnergyToTurn()
    Effect:
    The orientation of this Robot will change 90 degrees in a clockwise direction.
        new.getOrientation() = getOrientation().turnClockWise90()

    turnCounterClockwise90

    public void turnCounterClockwise90()
    Turn this Robot counterclockwise 90 degrees.

    Precondition:
    The energy this Robot currently has must be more then the energy it needs to turn.
        getAmountOfEnergy() >= getEnergyToTurn().getAmountOfEnergy()
    Postcondition:
    The energy of this robot will decrease due to the turning.
        new.getAmountOfEnergy() = getAmountOfEnergy() - getEnergyToTurn()
    Effect:
    The orientation of this Robot will change 90 degrees in a counter-clockwise direction.
        new.getOrientation() = getOrientation().turnCounterClockWise90()

public Orientation getOrientation()
    Returns the current orientation of this robot.

    getOrientationInt

    public int getOrientationInt()
    Returns the ordinal of the orientation.

    Returns:
    The ordinal of the orientation.
        result == getOrientation.ordinal()

    move

    public void move()
          throws IllegalStateException
    Move this Robot.

    Precondition:
    The current energy of this robot must be more then the energy to move.
        getAmountOfEnergy() >= getEnergyToMove()
    Effects:
  • Change the position of this Robot.
        setPosition(getOrientation.nextPosition(getPosition))
  • Remove the energy this robot has used due to moving.
        new.getAmountOfEnergy() = getAmountOfEnergy() - getEnergyToMove()
    • Throws:
    IllegalStateException - [CAN] There is no legal next position.
        getOrientation.nextPosition(getPosition).equals(getPosition())

    moveTo

    public void moveTo(Node node)
    Move this Robot to the given node's position.

    Parameters:
    node - Holds the position and energycost of the position this robot has to move to.
    Preconditions:
  • The energy required to reach the position must exist.
        energyRequiredToReach != null
  • The energy required to reach the position must be a valid energy.
        getEnergyRequiredToReach(node.getPosition()).isValidEnergy(maxEnergy)
    • Postconditions:
  • Remove the energy this robot has used due to moving.
        new.getAmountEnergy() = getAmountOfEnergy() - getEnergyToMove()
  • Change the position of this Robot.
        new.getPosition() = node.getPosition()
  • Change the orientation of this Robot.
        new.getOrientation() = node.getOrientation()

    • moveNextTo

    public void moveNextTo(Robot robot2)
    Move this robot and robot2 as close to each other as possible, while trying to use the least possible energy.

    Parameters:
    robot2 - The robot that this Robot will have to end up as close as possible to.
    Effect:
    Move this robot and robot2 as close to each other as possible, while trying to use the least possible energy.
        bestNodePairs = Node.bestNodePairs(new Node(null,
          getOrientation(), 0, getPosition(),
          robot2.getPosition()).allShortestPaths(),
          new Node(null, getOrientation(), 0, robot2.getPosition(),
          getPosition()).allShortestPaths())
        if (energyRequiredToReachRobot1Destination != null
          && energyRequiredToReachRobot1Destination.isValidEnergy(maxEnergy))
          moveTo(bestNodePairs.get(0)[0]
        if (energyRequiredToReachRobot2Destination != null
          && energyRequiredToReachRobot2Destination.isValidEnergy(robot2.getMaxEnergy()))
          moveTo(bestNodePairs.get(0)[1]

    shoot

    public void shoot()
    Shoot this Robot's laser if it can hit something.

    Precondition:
    This Robot has enough energy to shoot.
        getAmountOfEnergy() >= 1000
    Postcondition:
    One of the items the robot could hit is hit.
    Effect:
    This Robot's energy is decreased by 1000 Ws.
        new.getAmountOfEnergy() = getAmountOfEnergy() - 1000

    hit

    public void hit()
    Hit this Robot.

    Specified by:
    hit in class Element
    Effects:
  • This Robot it's maximum energy will decrease with 4000 Ws.
        new.getMaxEnergy().getAmountOfEnergy() =
          getMaxEnergy().getAmountOfEnergy() - 4000
  • This Robot's energy may not exceed it's maximum energy.
        If (getAmountOfEnergy() > new.getMaxEnergy())
          new.getAmountOfEnergy() = new.getMaxEnergy().getAmountOfEnergy()
  • If this Robot's maximum energy reaches 0 it will terminate itself.
        If (getMaxEnergy().getAmountOfEnergy() <= 0)
          this.terminate()

    • addItems

    public void addItems(Set<Item> itemsToAdd)
    Add a set of items to this Robot's possessions while keeping them ordered.

    Parameters:
    itemsToAdd - The set of items to add.
    Postconditions:
  • The items are added to this Robot's possessions if it has not been terminated and the item isn't null.
        if (!isTerminated())
          for itemToAdd in itemsToAdd
              if (itemToAdd != null)
                  new.getPossessions().contains(itemToAdd)
  • This Robot's possessions are sorted by weight from heavy to light.
        0 <= i <= j < new.getPossessions().size()
        new.getPossessions().get(i).compareTo(
          new.getPossessions().get(i + j)) >= 0

    • pickup

    public void pickup(Item item)
            throws IllegalStateException
    Pickup the given item if this Robot's position is the same as the item's position.

    Parameters:
    item - The item to pick up.
    Postcondition:
    This Robot is carrying the given item if it was in the same position.
        if (getPosition().equals(item.getPosition())
          new.getPossessions().contains(item)
    Effect:
    The item is picked up if it was in the same position.
        if (getPosition().equals(item.getPosition())
          item.removPosition()
    Throws:
    IllegalStateException - [CAN]

    use

    public void use(Item item)
         throws IllegalArgumentException
    Use the given item if this Robot can.

    Parameters:
    item - The item to use.
    Postconditions:
  • If this Robot is carrying the item but it is terminated, the item is discarded.
        if (item != null && item.isTerminated())
          !new.getPossessions().contains(item)
  • If this Robot is carrying the item and it has not been terminated use it.
        if (getPossessions().contains(item))
          item.use(this)
    • Throws:
    IllegalArgumentException - [CAN] If this Robot isn't carrying the item it cannot use it.
        !getPossessions().contains(item)

    drop

    public void drop(Item item)
          throws IllegalArgumentException
    Drop the given item.

    Parameters:
    item - The item to drop.
    Postcondition:
    This Robot is no longer carrying the give item.
        !new.getPossessions().contains(item)
    Effect:
    If the Robot is carrying the item, it will drop it.
        if (getPossessions().contains(item))
          item.setPosition(getPosition())
    Throws:
    IllegalArgumentException - [CAN]

    transferItems

    public void transferItems(Robot robot2)
    Transfer all items from this Robot to the given robot.

    Parameters:
    robot2 - The robot that will receive this Robot's items.
    Effect:
    If the two robots are capable of transfering items, the items from this Robot are transfered to robot2.
        if (!(isTerminated() || robot2 == null || robot2.isTerminated())
        && position == null
        && getPosition().getNeigbours().contains(robot2.getPosition()))
          robot2.addItems(getPossessions())
          new.getPossessions().size() == 0

    ithHeaviestItem

    public Item ithHeaviestItem(int ordinal)
                     throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
    Return the ordinal'th heaviest item this Robot is carrying.

    Parameters:
    ordinal - The ordinal of the item. (i.e. first == 1, second == 2, third == 3)
    Throws:
    IndexOutOfBoundsException - [CAN] There is no ordinal'th item.
        ordinal >= getPossessions().size()

    getPossessions

    @Basic
public Set<Item> getPossessions()
    Returns a set of all the items carried by this Robot.

    stepn

    public void stepn(int n)
    Execute n steps of this Robot's program if this Robot has a program.

    Parameters:
    n - The number of steps to execute.
    Effect:
    Execute n steps of the program if this Robot has a program.
        if (program != null)
          for i = 1..n
              program.step()

@Raw
public void setProgram(Program program)
    Set this Robot's program to the given program.

    Parameters:
    program - The program to give to this Robot.

    getProgram

    @Basic
public Program getProgram()

    terminate

    public void terminate()
    Terminate this Robot.

    Overrides:
    terminate in class Element
    Postconditions:
  • Forget your position.
        position = null
  • Forget your program.
        program = null
  • new.isTerminated() = true
    • Effects:
  • If this Robot has a position remove the robot from the position.
        getPosition().removeElement(this)
  • Terminate each item this Robot is carrying.
        for item in getPossessions()
          item.terminate()
